authors: Integral and Transpersonal Psychology, School of Consciousness and Transformation, California Institute of Integral Studies, San Francisco, CA, 94103, USA.
text: A previously reported experiment collected electrocortical data recorded simultaneously in pairs of people separated by distance. Reanalysis of those data confirmed the presence of a time-synchronous, statistically significant correlation in brain electrical activity of these distant "sender-receiver" pairs. Given the sensory shielding employed in the original experiment to avoid mundane explanations for such a correlation, this outcome is suggestive of an anomalous intersubjective connection.
title: Electrocortical correlations between pairs of isolated people: A reanalysis.
